Posts.Content: Hi , I am doing my second tax on thursday following 3 fec, I found the fec easier than the tax,I was very sick the first time but this was due to them forgetting to give me any anti sickness tabs till it was too late,the next times still had some nausea but not bad,constipated due to the anti sickness tabs but i didnt take anything and this sorted itself out in a week.just feel vaguely hungover for a week really and some headaches. I had pretty much the same steroid dosage for both tax and fec and have had completly different side effects so I cant blame the steroids as everyone else seems to. I have used the cold cap which I dont like but I still have enough hair to not bother with covering my head .I have pretty thin fine hair so I  go against the theory re thick hair.my theory is that as it is thin the cold cap is more efficient and cooling my scalp.Anyway what i am trying to say is that you might not loose anymore hair. goodluck for thursday
Posts.Title: Not looking forward to starting FEC on Thursday

Posts.Content: These oncologists need to read some of these posts, Mine was also pretty adamant that mine would fall out ,FEC 100,but  i insisted that would have a go with cold cap,I used the continuous cooling one,cant remember the name ,my memory is worryingly terrible after the chemo and on arimidex. After my success with keeping my hair ,the nurses all seemed to take more care with the cold cap for people and leave it on for the correct time after etc my hair definately thinned but was presentable enough for me.My main worry was that it would come back grey and again the nurse was fairly negative about the fact that at my age 47 it was likely to. Where I did loose it it has grown back thicker and darker than it has ever been!
Posts.Title: Hair falling out!

Posts.Content: hi emma, i am 12 days post first tax,havent really had any numbness but certainly had funny pains in my bust, most of my pain was just in the left side ,I got a few seconds throbbing in my head then boob then hip and knee but just on the left,?!
Posts.Title: docetaxel effects

Posts.Content: good glad you are getting it done, You do wonder whether it is a false economy not give everyone some sort of semi permenent line.The same with the white cell boosting injections,sometimes not giving them until people end up having to spend a few days in hospital
Posts.Title: Finally getting my portacath fitted yeah xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey , See while I was writing my reply ,Bongo has  replied to you.I knew she would as she is so good at responding to your sort of question
Posts.Title: MRI-CT-PET Scans

Posts.Content: Hi Tracy, Don't think i can be much help re the scans but just wanted to offer my support to you.I would certainly take some heart from the negative ct scan.CT scans and MRI scans tend to be used to look for different things(ligaments mri's ,lung problems ct's etc) I wonder if neither of them are particularly accurate at picking up bone  secondaries. From reading other posts(bongo) on here it also seems a bit strange re no talk of other therapies and  I presume you must be ER +ve as well. Anyway hoping that you will get some of your questions answered and will be able to get some sleep and relaxation whilst waiting for scan and result
Posts.Title: MRI-CT-PET Scans

Posts.Content: Hi Hairworries, I haven't read any of the other posts on this but just a thought If your theory is true why is letrozole more effective in post menopausal women than Tamoxifen .Tamoxifen blocks the oestrogen receptors whilst letrozole stops your body producing oestragen Just a thought
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: hi hairworries, what you say about letrozole and tamoxifen is correct .But tamoxifen blocks the action of oestragen at the level of the tumour so it would also stop the action of oestragens that come from your diet so therefore why is tamoxifen not used first line for post menopausal women. see where i am coming from?
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Hi RonRon, I had a portacath put in after my first FEC had it done under local but didnt get any sort of sedation and I would definately ask for something if I was to have it done again(which i hope i wont need) But once it is in it is really easy and went swimming etc with it in and no troubles with veins or infections. If it is being offered I would definately go for it. (I live in France where it is standard practice but not everything is better than the UK: ,no breast cancer nurse,poor communication and doctors who havent heard of discussion,so its all swings and roundabouts)
Posts.Title: About to start chemo. Implantable port/central line?

Posts.Content: Hi Suze, Things do seem to have happened quickly for you which is good but a bit mind blowing! Putting your chemo back a lttle bit wont matter and it would be good to get your mind around it and talk to some people if you can. I dont know how old your kids are? Mine are 9 and 7,I am 10 days after my 5th chemo,3 FEC and 2 TAX so far .one more to go. During the FEC ,I often felt a bit of a fraud and the 2nd and third weeks really carried on as normal ,gardening/holidays/ fitting kitchens etc. The tax does seem to be harder going as the effects seem to go on longer,this second one has been easier as the kids are back at school.Alot of the sie effects I have had are more annoying and get you down abit (sore nose,dry skin,feeling like you are eating cardboard for days on end) they have not effected the care of my children (unless you call an incredibly messy house as an effect) I do seem to have been "lucky" so far as have not had any major infections needing antibiotics but I dont know what the actual statistics are for the rate of neutropaenic sepsis for people having chemo and as dream thief often says the people who write on here are going to tend to be those that are having a rough time don't know if any of that helps Katharine
Posts.Title: Hi ... and help please!!

Posts.Content: interesting on the paracetamol,I am 3 fec down and spoke to the oncologist yesterday as suffering quite bad headaches to ask if i could use ibuprofen,she was not keen and said i could not use them until 4 or 5 days after the steroids had finished as they have some of the same side effects. Also I would personally steer clear of compound headache tablets as you need to be careful re other ingredients ,express usually means caffeine.Also cheaper to buy own brand Ibuprofen and have it with a cup of coffee! I also had lots of sickness after 1st FEC and nausea on next ones,ice pops and marmite on toast did it for me goodluck Katharine
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Hi G n J Just looked it up to check but ibuprofen can  also lower temperature.just for information, .I agree re phoning hospital team to check.
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Hi G n J Just looked it up to check but ibuprofen can  also lower temperature.just for information, .I agree re phoning hospital team to check.
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: interesting on the paracetamol,I am 3 fec down and spoke to the oncologist yesterday as suffering quite bad headaches to ask if i could use ibuprofen,she was not keen and said i could not use them until 4 or 5 days after the steroids had finished as they have some of the same side effects. Also I would personally steer clear of compound headache tablets as you need to be careful re other ingredients ,express usually means caffeine.Also cheaper to buy own brand Ibuprofen and have it with a cup of coffee! I also had lots of sickness after 1st FEC and nausea on next ones,ice pops and marmite on toast did it for me goodluck Katharine
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: reading your replies to this problem only brings up another problem for me who is apparently likely to be on tamoxifen for 10 yrs. Does anyone have sex whilst on Tamoxifen or Letrazole and how do husbands manage?
Posts.Title: Smear Test

Posts.Content: Hi Gem, I can only give you my experience so far as I have had 1 FEC and am now day 9 and waiting to see what happens .I was very unsure re trying the cold cap not particularly worried re losing my hair but terrified that it would grow back grey as at 48 I have no grey hairs so far. So i have given it a go ,felt cold at the beginning but no headaches then or after.do feel a bit self conscious when you are wearing it but only a few people are going to see you.the slightly extra time you need to be there is nothing in the greater scheme of things. At least I cant regret not trying
Posts.Title: cold cap??

Posts.Content: thankyou
Posts.Title: Breast cancer remission and 5 year plus survivors

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief, I just wanted to say that there is a link between HRT and breast cancer and your doctor should explain this to you before you start.It only occurs after longer term use also this is probably not the case for people who start HRT before what would have been their natural menopause
Posts.Title: I feel Shellshocked.

Posts.Content: hi hair worries. I was fec 100 and Paxman. My hair was fine and not particularly thick and I did have it cut to a shortish style before I started but it seems to have continued growing through out treatment.More seems to have fallen out during the tax than the fec but that could just be a hangover effect
Posts.Title: CMF OR FEC WITH A COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Hi I don't know anything about CMF but I have just completed 3 FEC 100 3 Tax and used the cold cap(paxman machine) and have kept enough hair for me not to have to worry re wigs or headwear, the cold cap does make your treatment a bit longer but an hour or so every 3 weeks is nothing in the grand scheme of things.It isnt particularly pleasant but again doable. You must make sure that the cap fits as the top of my head where I could feel that there was always a bit of a gap between cap and head has lost a fair bit of hair. It does seem quite an individual thing as my hair seems to hold on tight generally as I have kept a fair bit of all parts of my body hair! Good luck in your decision making, generally it seems although we all worry about hair loss to begin with as people move on through treatment hair loss becomes a much more minor issue compared to the potential  consequences of not having treatment
Posts.Title: CMF OR FEC WITH A COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Hi Just wondered  if people could help,I had my final tax today (i wont miss it but do feel I am loosing my security  blanket) I asked my consultant about starting tamoxifen and he said I can start it now or he prefers to wait until the radiotherapy is finished just wondered  what happened to others? Also how quickly after finishing chemo did you all start radio again the consultant says between 3 to 8 weeks does this sound normal to every one? Thanks
Posts.Title: after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Chloecat, Just to say that once you have been diagnosed with cancer your GP has to do a 'cancer care Review ' once a year,so even if you have seen them in between if they havent ticked the right boxes they might need to see you again.I wouldnt worry about the word review and hopefully she will be able to sort out the aching joints. .........keep fighting
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: How long was the op ? They do give blood thinning injections into your belly to prevent blood clots
Posts.Title: unknown puncture marks

Posts.Content: so glad i read your post today margr20, I am day 3 from 1st FEC and have been in the cant do this place(sickness and weakness) but now looking forward to next weekend with some hope
Posts.Title: so my nightmare begins

Posts.Content: Hi jmwatson, I am wondering why it was due to the injections as i am on them too and surely they are supposed to do the opposite,now a little worried
Posts.Title: infection risk

Posts.Content: thanks,that sounds hopeful very sick the first one but they forgot to give me the antisickness meds,nausea and headaches with the next 2 but pretty much back to normal after 7 days each time,v ratty with my husband for the first week also which didnt go down well! have still got a reasonable head of hair ,leg hair also intact i used the paxman cold cap so hoping to continue with that but there is only 1 machine in the department and it seems like luck as to who gets it! watering eyes and nose for last 7 days before the next treatment but then it seems to go. I went for a short run with the dog this morning my first since before diagnosis in April which felt good but now starting to get nervous about how I am going to get on with the TAX which is thursday,What were you side effects?
Posts.Title: infection risk

Posts.Content: Hi, Just about to start my first tac after 3 fec,i am on the slow release 1 injection already so hopefully sounds like might be ok
Posts.Title: infection risk

Posts.Content: Hi Spammie, Had to answer this one,I think it depends a bit what age you are a bit ? I am 48 and had mammogram and u/s Nov 13,(it is not unusual to start screening a bit earlier in france,although I know it is changing to 47 v soon in the UK).both were apparently normal but i had some calcification and this was my first mammogram I was told to come back for review in 6 months and then go onto normal 3 yearly. I found a lump 8 weeks later ,had previous cysts and just had normal mammogram waited another 3 months ,further mammogram normal but u/s should something Now had my 3rd FEC for lymph node positive 18mm tumour. I obviously have some issues i havent fully resolved yet about this. The surgeon who i trust assures me both sets of mammograms are normal.this is the problem with screening mammograms in the under 50's they arent great. the u/s is another issue ,i think it must have been missed and like you am not sure what or not to do.the u/s is dynamic therefore much more difficult to prove anything the films of the u/s have gone missing but i could request some more. Sorry this isnt much help to you but good for me to write it down
Posts.Title: An uneasy question to ask about a previous mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi, Not very satisfactory really for you,If it is going to be more than 2 weeks before your next appointment would be I would ,phone and speak to the Doctor as I think it is a bit unfair to leave you hanging like this as she doesnt really sound as though she has reassured you.It would be a brave GP who would not refer a woman with self noted nipple changes,lumpy breasts and a family history,for everybodies reassurance including hers. Katharine
Posts.Title: Nipple change

Posts.Content: Good ,welldone,now you know something is being done I hope you can enjoy your weekend a bit. Let us know how you get on Katharine
Posts.Title: Nipple change

Posts.Content: Hi Moll, I started my rads 10 days ago and I am really struggling,physically fine still but it is my mind that is the problem. I found chemo a doddle compared to this ,I didnt cry during chemo but now everytime I get into the changing room after the treatment i have a little cry and I havent remembered to take tissues yet! With chemo i found that "I only had cancer a few days every 3 weeks" now "i have cancer everyday" if you see what I mean. will send you a private message soon but look after yourself
Posts.Title: varicose veins

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, There are quite a few of us here who live abroad and this site is really good as, although care seems to be good for us all, i think we all miss the support of a breast cancer nurse or just the easy chatting to nurses or fellow patients that does not happen when you are not a native. I cant help you much with your other queries as I am just post 1st FEC and was very sick! sending my support to you from France Katharine
Posts.Title: finger nails and chemo

Posts.Content: great news,all that worry!
Posts.Title: Good news!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Do you still have a temperature? I was just trying to send you a friend request, but dont seem able to, as I have just had lumpectomy but I also live in France so wondered if we could compare notes.
Posts.Title: Freaking out slightly

Posts.Content: Hi Yes steroids standard practice,they should help any hay fever symptoms though as an unintentional side effect. Katharine
Posts.Title: steroids

Posts.Content: Hi Just wanted to say hi and hope that you can try to occupy your mind a little with something else.I have definately found keeping off google  helps me with this.
Posts.Title: Another Biopsy really scared

Posts.Content: hi, i have been meaning to write for a long time but time just gets away. I am a member of the class of 2014,WLE in May,x6 chemo,radiotherapy and now on zoladex and exemastane and i am just off to the airport to fly to Newcastle where I am running(probably not all the way) the great north run in aid of macmillan ,as i got so much support from this website last year,I am glad to say that this morning I reached my £1000 sponsorship target so all I need to do now is complete the task. So although at times my, like everyones, journey was hard at the moment I am able to reep the benefits ,as I hope all of you going through the hard parts of treatment at the moment will be able to in future. I will get back on here next week when hopefully it is all done to write about the things I have found usefull about getting back to some sort of fittness. In the mean time if anyone  is watching the telly on Sunday I have Kath99 on my MACMILLAN shirt.
Posts.Title: great north run

Posts.Content: Hi JoJo That is so unfair they just dont realise the anxiety that these sort of changes provoke.If they found things were worse than expecting they would be bringing appointments forward not back.Hopefully your BC nurse will get back to you and be able to explain exactly what is going on it is most likely to be purely a scheduling issue. have a cup of tea
Posts.Title: reschedueled oncology appointment

Posts.Content: sorry the cup,of tea comment wasnt supposed to be facetious
Posts.Title: reschedueled oncology appointment

Posts.Content: Having just unpacked my sons rugby bag.who ever decided that England played in white didn't do the washing!!!!(he doesn't play for England by the way just would like to)
Posts.Title: why do England wear white!!!!!

Posts.Content: just a quickie as mid cooking christmas dinner as half the family are working tomorrow. Dont worry re not being staged as this is not uncommon these days.I was 47 at diagnosis and like you and most premenopausal women on here had op plus chemo plus radiation plus/minus anti hormone tablets so try not to worry ,How old are your kids? also I didnt say anything to anyone except husband and 1 friend until I had full diagnosis and initial treatment plan was set in place, good wishes for christmas , Katharine
Posts.Title: Just joined the roller coaster - help !

Posts.Content: well done Moo, I am with you Monika.I am now 17 down 7 to go with a long journey either side and I find the process difficult and as you say very impersonal .The first 2 weeks I found particularly hard but it has got better ,although had a little tear in the changing room again yesterday. I allways wonder what is going on when the machine makes different noises or you have to wait extra long lying there with nothing happening and always no explanation. Good luck Monica Do you finish before xmas? I finish the 15th
Posts.Title: Last Radiotherapy today.
